title: Daniel Craig on playing Bond: 'I'm over it'
text:
'Spectre' teaser trailer promises darkest Bond movie yet 
Daniel Craig is done with playing James Bond - for at least two years. 
The Brit will hit the big screen as 007 for a fourth time when Spectre is released next month, and he appears determined to step away from the spy franchise when he's completed the current round of promotions. 
"I'd rather break this glass and slash my wrists... I'm over it at the moment," he says. "We're done. All I want to do is move on. For at least a year or two, I just don't want to think about it. 
"I don't know what the next step is. I've no idea. Not because I'm trying to be cagey. Who the f**k knows? At the moment, we've done it. I'm not in discussion with anybody about anything. If I did another Bond movie, it would only be for the money." 
And Craig suggests it might be time for the Bond bosses to start looking for another 007, adding, "The best acting is when you're not concerned about the surface. And Bond is the opposite of that. You have to be bothered about how you're looking. 
"It's a struggle. I know that how Bond wears a suit and walks into a room is important. But, as an actor, I don't want to give a f--- about what I look like!" Sponsored Links
